    • Method Detail

      • isEnabled

        public boolean isEnabled()
        Returns true if the block scanner is enabled.

        If the block scanner is disabled, no volume scanners will be created, and no threads will start.

      • addVolumeScanner

        public void addVolumeScanner(FsVolumeReference ref)
        Set up a scanner for the given block pool and volume.
        Parameters:
        ref - A reference to the volume.

      • removeVolumeScanner

        public void removeVolumeScanner(FsVolumeSpi volume)
        Stops and removes a volume scanner.

        This function will block until the volume scanner has stopped.

        Parameters:
        volume - The volume to remove.

      • removeAllVolumeScanners

        public void removeAllVolumeScanners()
        Stops and removes all volume scanners.

        This function will block until all the volume scanners have stopped.

      • enableBlockPoolId

        void enableBlockPoolId(String bpid)
        Enable scanning a given block pool id.
        Parameters:
        bpid - The block pool id to enable scanning for.

      • disableBlockPoolId

        void disableBlockPoolId(String bpid)
        Disable scanning a given block pool id.
        Parameters:
        bpid - The block pool id to disable scanning for.

      • getVolumeStats

        VolumeScanner.Statistics getVolumeStats(String volumeId)

      • printStats

        void printStats(StringBuilder p)

      • markSuspectBlock

        void markSuspectBlock(String storageId,
                    ExtendedBlock block)
        Mark a block as "suspect." This means that we should try to rescan it soon. Note that the VolumeScanner keeps a list of recently suspicious blocks, which it uses to avoid rescanning the same block over and over in a short time frame.
        Parameters:
        storageId - The ID of the storage where the block replica is being stored.
        block - The block's ID and block pool id.
